snippet: Demand has far surpassed production of parts, a concern that lawmakers are likely to bring up with the automaker’s chief this week at a hearing.
abstract: Car owners criticize General Motors for pace of repairs after recall for faulty ignition switch that has been linked to at least 13 deaths; about 177,000 cars have been repaired so far, or 7 percent of total number affected, four months since recall began; slow pace is likely to be among questions chief executive Mary T Barra faces before House subcommittee investigating GM's failure to fix faulty switch.
lead_paragraph: Demand has far surpassed production of parts, a concern that lawmakers are likely to bring up with the automaker’s chief this week at a hearing.

headline.main: Car Owners Criticize Pace of G.M. Recall Repairs
headline.print_headline: Car Owners Criticize Pace of G.M. Recall Repairs

keywords.value: Chevrolet Division of General Motors Corp
